snippet: Police officials say the cellphone and handset industry has not done enough with technology to solve the theft problem.
abstract: Law enforcement officials say cellphone industry is not doing enough to combat growing theft of popular devices; nationwide database for identifying stolen cellphones has not helped stanch thefts, in part because many stolen phones end up overseas out of database’s reach, and in part because identifiers are easily modified; authorities say carriers and handset makers have little incentive to fix problem.

byline.original: By BRIAN X. CHEN and MALIA WOLLAN

lead_paragraph: Police officials say the cellphone and handset industry has not done enough with technology to solve the theft problem.

headline.main: Cellphone Thefts Grow, but the Industry Looks the Other Way
headline.print_headline: Cellphone Thefts Grow, but the Industry Looks the Other Way
